clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Bedside Placement of Nasal Jejunal Tube Confirmed by Ultrasound Compared to Placement by Endoscope in Patients With SAP
clinical_study.official_title: Study to Compare the Placement Method of Nasal Jejunal Tube in Patients With Severe Acute Pancreatitis: Bedside Placement With Ultrasound Confirmation Versus Placement Endoscopically

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators assessed the utility of ultrasonography in confirming the position of nasal jejunal tube after bedside placement when compared with endoscopic placement in patients with severe acute pancreatitis.
Primary endpoint:
Success rate.
Secondary Endpoint:
Adverse effects, Change of intra-abdominal pressure (1h before, 1h after and 3 days after placement), Tolerance of enteral nutrition, Time to approach the target calories.

detailed_description.textblock:
We set this randomised trial to assess the safety and utility of ultrasonography in confirming the position of nasal jejunal tube after bedside placement when compared with endoscopic placement in patients with severe acute pancreatitis.
Primary endpoint:
Success rate.
Secondary Endpoint:
Adverse effects, Change of intra-abdominal pressure (1h before, 1h after and 3 days after placement), Tolerance of enteral nutrition, Time to approach the target calories.

primary_outcome.description: Success rate is defined as the right position of nasal jejunal tube confirmed by X-ray.

secondary_outcome.description: gastrointestinal perforation, gastrointestinal bleeding, tie of the tube, blocking of the tube
the intra-abdominal pressure at 1h before, 1h after and 3 days after placement

secondary_outcome.measure: Time interval to approach the target calories
secondary_outcome.description: The exact time interval from the placement of the tube to the time that the patient can tolerate the target enteral nutrition.
